meaning: राक्षसैः with rakshasas, बद्धवैरस्य deeprooted enmity, तस्य his, अन्यकार्यविषक्तस्य while he was engaged in some other work, यशस्विनी a glorious lady, भार्या wife, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, हृता was abducted.
translation: "While Rama was engaged otherwise, his glorious wife Sita was abducted by Ravana actuated by deeprooted enmity of demons with him.

text:
तस्याः सकाशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात्।

कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साह्यं विषयवासिनि।।5.1.155।।
meaning: अहम् I, रामशासनात् by Rama's command, दूतः emissary, तस्याः her, सकाशम् for, गमिष्ये I shall go, विषयवासिनि O resident of his kingdom, रामस्य of Rama, साह्यम् help, कर्तुम् to render, अर्हसि it proper for you.
translation: "I am going as Rama's emissary to search for his wife. It is proper for you to render help since you are a resident of his kingdom.

text:
अथवा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम्।

आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते।।5.1.156।।
meaning: अथवा alternatively, मैथिलीम् Mythili, अक्लिष्टकारिणम् one who may makes work easy (without any trouble), रामं च and Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, ते to your, वक्त्रम् mouth, आगमिष्यामि I will reach, सत्यम् truly, ते you, प्रतिशृणोमि I promise.

text:
एवमुक्ता हनुमता सुरसा कामरूपिणी।

अब्रवीन्नातिवर्तेन्मां कश्चिदेष वरो मम।।5.1.157।।
meaning: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been spoken, कामरूपिणी one who can assume any form at free will, सुरसा Surasa, अब्रवीत् said, कश्चित् no one, नातिवर्तेत cannot cross, एषः such, मम to me, वरः boon.
translation:
Having heard Hanuman, Surasa capable of taking any form at her free will told him that no one can cross (her region) as she had been given such a boon(by the
Creator)৷৷

text:
तं प्रयान्तं समुद्वीक्ष्य सुरसा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।

बलं जिज्ञासमाना वै नागमाता हनूमतः।।5.1.158।।
meaning: नागमाता mother of serpents, सुरसा Surasa, हनूमतः of Hanuman, बलम् strength, जिज्ञासमाना वै desirous of knowing, प्रयान्तम् who was attempting to go away, तम् her, समुद्वीक्ष्य observing, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
translation: Surasa, mother of serpents, observing that Hanuman was attempting to escape, said this in order to gauge his strength:

text:
प्रविश्य वदनं मेऽद्य गन्तव्यं वानरोत्तम।

वर एष पुरा दत्तो मम धात्रेति सत्वरा।।5.1.159।।

व्यादाय विपुलं वक्त्रं स्थिता सा मारुतेः पुरः।
meaning: वानरोत्तम O best of the vanaras, अद्य today, मे my, वदनम् face (mouth), प्रविश्य after entering, गन्तव्यम् you may go, एषः वरः such a boon, पुरा past, मम to me, धात्रा by Brahma, दत्तः is given, इति thus, सत्वरा quickly, विपुलम् wide, वक्त्रम् mouth, व्यादाय opened, सा she, मारुतेः vanara's, पुरः front, स्थिता stood.
translation: "O best vanara you must pass through my mouth today. Such is the boon granted to me by Brahma in the past". Then she quickly opened her big mouth and stood.

text:
एवमुक्तः सुरसया क्रुद्धो वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.1.160।।

अब्रवीत्कुरु वै वक्त्रं येन मां विषहिष्यसे।
meaning: सुरसया by Surasa, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been spoken to, वानरपुङ्गवः supreme vanara, क्रुद्धः got angry, अब्रवीत् he said, वक्त्रम् mouth, कुरु वै open, येन in such a way, माम् me, विषहिष्यसे you can bear me.
translation: Thus addressed by Surasa, Hanuman the supreme vanara said, "Open your mouth wide enough to hold me."

text:
इत्युक्त्वा सुरसां क्रुद्धो धशयोजनमायता।।5.1.161।।

दशयोजनविस्तारो बभूव हनुमांस्तदा।
meaning: तदा then, हनुमान् Hanuman, सुरसां Surasa, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, क्रुद्धः angry, दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, आयतां wide, दशयोजनविस्तारः ten yojanas in breadth, बभूव became.
translation: Provoked by the words of Surasa, Hanuman stretched himself to ten yojanas.

text:
तं दृष्ट्वा मेघसङ्काशं दशयोजनमायतम्।।5.1.162।।

चकार सुरसा चास्यं विंशद्योजनमायतम्।
meaning: दशयोजनम् ten yojanas, आयतम् wide, मेघसङ्काशम् like a cloud, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सुरसा च Surasa too, आस्यम् her mouth, विंशद्योजनम् twenty yojanas, आयतम् wide, चकार stretched.
translation: Seeing his body stretched to ten yojanas like a cloud, Surasa also widened her mouth to twenty yojanas.

text:
हनुमांस्तु ततः क्रुद्धस्त्रिंशद्योजनमायतः।।5.1.163।।

चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं चत्वारिंशत्तथोच्छ्रितम्।

बभूव हनुमावनीरः पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.164।।
meaning: ततः then, हनुमांस्तु Hanuman also, क्रुद्धः in anger, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, आयतः wide, सुरसा Surasa, तथा like that, वक्त्रम् mouth, चत्वारिंशम् forty yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् high, चकार did, वीरः hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः fifty yojanas high, बभूव became.
translation:
Provoked, Hanuman further stretched his body to thirty yojanas and Surasa on her own enlarged her mouth to forty yojanas. Then the great hero Hanuman stretched his
body to fifty yojanas.

text:
हनुमांस्तु ततः क्रुद्धस्त्रिंशद्योजनमायतः।।5.1.163।।

चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं चत्वारिंशत्तथोच्छ्रितम्।

बभूव हनुमावनीरः पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.164।।
meaning: ततः then, हनुमांस्तु Hanuman also, क्रुद्धः in anger, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, आयतः wide, सुरसा Surasa, तथा like that, वक्त्रम् mouth, चत्वारिंशम् forty yojanas, उच्छ्रितम् high, चकार did, वीरः hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः fifty yojanas high, बभूव became.
translation:
Provoked, Hanuman further stretched his body to thirty yojanas and Surasa on her own enlarged her mouth to forty yojanas. Then the great hero Hanuman stretched his
body to fifty yojanas.

text:
चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं षष्टियोजनमायतम्।

तथैव हनुमावनीरः सप्ततीयोजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.165।।
meaning: सुरसा Surasa, वक्त्रम् mouth, षष्टियोजनम् sixty yojanas, आयतम् wide, चकार did, वीरः heroic, हनुमान् Hanuman, तथैव in the same way, सप्ततीयोजनोच्छ्रितः increased to seventy yojanas.
translation: Surasa widened her mouth sixty yojanas and then the heroic Hanuman enlarged himself to seventy yojanas.

text:
चकार सुरसा वक्त्रमशीतीयोजनायतम्।

हनुमानचलप्रख्यो नवतीयोजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.166।।
meaning: सुरसा Surasa, वक्त्रम् mouth, अशीतीयोजनायतम् eighty yojanas wide, चकार made, अचलप्रख्यः like a mountain, हनुमान् Hanuman, नवतीयोजनोच्छ्रितः ninety yojanas.
translation: Surasa widened her mouth to eighy yojanas and the heroic Hanuman grew up to ninety yojanas, looking like a mountain.

text:
चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं शतयोजनमायतम्

तव सानुषु विश्रान्तः शेषं प्रक्रमतामिति।

तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यादितं त्वास्यं वायुपुत्रः सुबुद्धिमान्।

दीर्घजिह्वं सुरसया सुघोरं नरकोपमम्।।5.1.167।।

सुसंक्षिप्यात्मनः कायं बभूवाङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः।
meaning:
सुबुद्धिमान् very intelligent, वायुपुत्रः Hanuman, सुरसया by Surasa, व्यादितम् opened, दीर्घजिह्वम् long tongued, सुघोरम् dreadful, नरकोपमम् like hell, तत् आस्यम् that mouth,
दृष्ट्वा on seeing, आत्मनः his, कायम् body, सुसंक्षिप्य shrunk, अङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः of the size of a thumb, बभूव became.
translation: Intelligent Hanuman observing Surasa's enlarged mouth open and dreadful like hell with a long tongue, suddenly shrunk his body to the size of a thumb.

text:
सोऽभिपत्याशु तद्वक्त्रं निष्पत्य च महाबलः।

अन्तरिक्षे स्थितः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.1.168।।
meaning: श्रीमान् glorious one, महाबलः mighty, सः he, आशु immediatly, तद्वक्त्रम् her mouth, अभिपत्य got in, निष्पत्य च and got out, अन्तरिक्षे in the sky, स्थितः stood, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation: Glorious and mighty Hanuman quickly went into her mouth and got out and stood in the sky and said:.

text:
प्रविष्टोऽस्मि हि ते वक्त्रं दाक्षायणि नमोऽस्तु ते।

गमिष्ये यत्र वैदेही सत्यं चासीद्वरस्तव।।5.1.169।।
meaning: दाक्षायणि O dughter of Daksha, ते your, वक्त्रम् mouth, प्रविष्टः I have entered, अस्मि हि I am indeed, ते to you, नमः salutations, अस्तु may be, वैदेही Vaidhehi, यत्र wherever, गमिष्ये I will go, तव your, वरः च boon also, सत्यम् true, आसीत् was.
translation: "O Dakshayani I have indeed entered your mouth and your boon has come true (as nobody can go against the boon of the Creator). Allow me to proceed in quest of Vaidhehi. My salutations to you."

text:
तं दृष्ट्वा वदनान्मुक्तं चन्द्रं राहुमुखादिव।

अब्रवीत्सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण वानरम्।।5.1.170।।
meaning:
राहुमुखात् from the mouth of Rahu, चन्द्रमिव like the Moon, वदनात् from the mouth, मुक्तम् released, तं him, वानरम् that vanara, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुरसा देवी the divine Surasa, स्वेन in
her true, रूपेण form, अब्रवीत् said.
translation: Seeing Hanuman released out of her mouth like the Moon released from the mouth of Rahu, Surasa assumed her true form and said:

text:
अर्थसिद्ध्यै हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्।

समानयस्व वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना।।5.1.171।।
meaning: सौम्य O noble one, हरिश्रेष्ठ O best of vanaras, अर्थसिद्ध्यै for achieving your purpose, यथासुखम् with pleasure, गच्छ proceed, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, महात्मना with the great self, राघवेण with Raghava, समानयस्व unite.
translation: "O noble vanara proceed happily to achieve your purpose. Go and unite Vaidehi with the noble self, Raghava.

text:
तत्तृतीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम्।

साधु साध्विति भूतानि प्रशशंसुस्तदा हरिम्।।5.1.172।।
meaning: सुदुष्करम् very difficult, हनुमतः of Hanuman, तत् that, तृतीयं कर्म a third feat, दृष्ट्वा after witnessing, तदा then, भूतानि living beings, साधु साधु इति welldone, welldone this, हरिम् vanara, प्रशशंसुः applauded.
translation: Witnessing Hanuman achieving a very difficult feat for the third time, all the living beings applauded him saying "Well done, welldone".

text:
स सागरमनाधृष्यमभ्येत्य वरुणालयम्।

जगामाकाशमाविश्य वेगेन गरुडोपमः।।5.1.173।।
meaning: वेगेन speedily, गरुडोपमः like Garuda, सः he, अनाधृष्यम् invincible, वरुणालयम् abode of varuna, सागरम् ocean, अभ्येत्य piercing through, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य coursing, जगाम went.
translation: Rising above the invincible ocean, the abode of lord Varuna, Hanuman coursed through the sky speedily like Garuda.

text:
सेविते वारिधाराभिः पतगैश्च निषेविते।

चरिते कैशिकाचार्यैरैरावतनिषेविते।।5.1.174।।

सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः।

विमानैः सम्पतद्भिश्च विमलैः समलङ्कृते।।5.1.175।।

वज्राशनिसमाघातैः पावकैरुपशोभिते।

कृतपुण्यैर्महाभागैः स्वर्गजिद्भिरलङ्कृते।।5.1.176।।

वहता हव्यमत्यर्धं सेविते चित्रभानुना।

ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागण विभूषिते।।5.1.177।।

महर्षिगणगन्धर्वनागयक्षसमाकुले।

विविक्ते विमले विश्वे विश्वावसुनिषेविते।।5.1.178।।

देवराजगजाक्रान्ते चन्द्रसूर्यपथे शिवे।

विताने जीवलोकस्य वितते ब्रह्मनिर्मिते।।5.1.179।।

बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः।

जगाम वायुमार्गे तु गरुत्मानिव मारुतिः।।5.1.180।।
meaning:
वारिधाराभिः with clouds that release torrents, सेविते frequented by, पतगैश्च by birds, निषेविते inhabited by, कैशिकाचार्यैः by masters (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) of music and dance (Kaisikaart and science of music), चरिते traversed by, ऐरावतनिषेविते attended by elephant Airabata (of Indra), सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः with aerial vehicles drawn by
lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents, सम्पतद्भि: driven by, विमलैः by clear, विमानैः by aerial vehicles, समलङ्कृते well decorated, वज्राशनिसमाघातैः by the god of fire who strike fiercely like a thunderbolt, पावकैः by fires, उपशोभिते looking splendid, कृतपुण्यैः by those who have performed meritorious deeds, महाभागैः by accomplished people, स्वर्गजिद्भि: by those who conquered heaven, अलङ्कृते decorated, अत्यर्थम् greatly, हव्यम् havis,वहता carrying, चित्रभानुना by fire, सेविते attended by, ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागणविभूषिते adorned with planets, Moon, Sun and stars constellations, महर्षिगणगन्धर्व नागयक्षसमाकुले filled with groups of eminent sages gandharvas, nagas, yakshas, विविक्ते isolated region, विमले cloudless, विश्वे by vishva, विश्वावसुनिषेविते inhabited by Vishvavasu, देवराजगजाक्रान्ते sporting ground for the elephant of Indra, चन्द्रसूर्यपथे in the path of Moon and Sun, शिवे an auspicious place, जीवलोकस्य for the living beings, ब्रह्मनिर्मिते created by Brahma, वितते extensive, विताने canopy, वरैः by the esteemed, वीरैः by heroes, विद्याधरगणैः by Vidyadhara groups, बहुशः frequently, सेविते attended by, वायुमार्गे the path of wind, मारुतिः Hanuman, गरुत्मानिव like Garuda, जगाम went.
translation: Hanuman passed through the path of wind like Garuda. The region was refreshed with clouds that released torrents of rain and frequented by birds. The great masters of music (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) trained in Kasika moved there driven by lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents and were moving in different aerial vehicles. It was splendid with god at fire who strikes fiercely like thunderbolt. It was inhabited by great sages who had acquired merit. The region was traversed by firegod who carried havis in large quantities earnestly. It was decorated with planets, constellations, Moon, Sun and clusters of stars. It was filled with groups of greal sages, gandharvas, nagas and yakshas. It was isolated part of the universe traversed by the king of gandharvas like Vishvavasu. It was an auspicious path for Moon and Sun, a sporting ground for Airavata, the vehicle of lord Indra. It was an extensive world of living beings created by Brahma. It was frequented by many heroes ascending to heaven and blocked by vidyadharas.

text:
सेविते वारिधाराभिः पतगैश्च निषेविते।

चरिते कैशिकाचार्यैरैरावतनिषेविते।।5.1.174।।

बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः।

जगाम वायुमार्गे तु गरुत्मानिव मारुतिः।।5.1.180।।
meaning:
वारिधाराभिः with clouds that release torrents, सेविते frequented by, पतगैश्च by birds, निषेविते inhabited by, कैशिकाचार्यैः by masters (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) of music and dance (Kaisikaart and science of music), चरिते traversed by, ऐरावतनिषेविते attended by elephant Airabata (of Indra), सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः with aerial vehicles drawn by
lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents, सम्पतद्भि: driven by, विमलैः by clear, विमानैः by aerial vehicles, समलङ्कृते well decorated, वज्राशनिसमाघातैः by the god of fire who strike fiercely like a thunderbolt, पावकैः by fires, उपशोभिते looking splendid, कृतपुण्यैः by those who have performed meritorious deeds, महाभागैः by accomplished people, स्वर्गजिद्भि: by those who conquered heaven, अलङ्कृते decorated, अत्यर्थम् greatly, हव्यम् havis,वहता carrying, चित्रभानुना by fire, सेविते attended by, ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागणविभूषिते adorned with planets, Moon, Sun and stars constellations, महर्षिगणगन्धर्व नागयक्षसमाकुले filled with groups of eminent sages gandharvas, nagas, yakshas, विविक्ते isolated region, विमले cloudless, विश्वे by vishva, विश्वावसुनिषेविते inhabited by Vishvavasu, देवराजगजाक्रान्ते sporting ground for the elephant of Indra, चन्द्रसूर्यपथे in the path of Moon and Sun, शिवे an auspicious place, जीवलोकस्य for the living beings, ब्रह्मनिर्मिते created by Brahma, वितते extensive, विताने canopy, वरैः by the esteemed, वीरैः by heroes, विद्याधरगणैः by Vidyadhara groups, बहुशः frequently, सेविते attended by, वायुमार्गे the path of wind, मारुतिः Hanuman, गरुत्मानिव like Garuda, जगाम went.
translation: Hanuman passed through the path of wind like Garuda. The region was refreshed with clouds that released torrents of rain and frequented by birds. The great masters of music (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) trained in Kasika moved there driven by lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents and were moving in different aerial vehicles. It was splendid with god at fire who strikes fiercely like thunderbolt. It was inhabited by great sages who had acquired merit. The region was traversed by firegod who carried havis in large quantities earnestly. It was decorated with planets, constellations, Moon, Sun and clusters of stars. It was filled with groups of greal sages, gandharvas, nagas and yakshas. It was isolated part of the universe traversed by the king of gandharvas like Vishvavasu. It was an auspicious path for Moon and Sun, a sporting ground for Airavata, the vehicle of lord Indra. It was an extensive world of living beings created by Brahma. It was frequented by many heroes ascending to heaven and blocked by vidyadharas.

बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः।

जगाम वायुमार्गे तु गरुत्मानिव मारुतिः।।5.1.180।।
meaning:
वारिधाराभिः with clouds that release torrents, सेविते frequented by, पतगैश्च by birds, निषेविते inhabited by, कैशिकाचार्यैः by masters (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) of music and dance (Kaisikaart and science of music), चरिते traversed by, ऐरावतनिषेविते attended by elephant Airabata (of Indra), सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः with aerial vehicles drawn by
lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents, सम्पतद्भि: driven by, विमलैः by clear, विमानैः by aerial vehicles, समलङ्कृते well decorated, वज्राशनिसमाघातैः by the god of fire who strike fiercely like a thunderbolt, पावकैः by fires, उपशोभिते looking splendid, कृतपुण्यैः by those who have performed meritorious deeds, महाभागैः by accomplished people, स्वर्गजिद्भि: by those who conquered heaven, अलङ्कृते decorated, अत्यर्थम् greatly, हव्यम् havis,वहता carrying, चित्रभानुना by fire, सेविते attended by, ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागणविभूषिते adorned with planets, Moon, Sun and stars constellations, महर्षिगणगन्धर्व नागयक्षसमाकुले filled with groups of eminent sages gandharvas, nagas, yakshas, विविक्ते isolated region, विमले cloudless, विश्वे by vishva, विश्वावसुनिषेविते inhabited by Vishvavasu, देवराजगजाक्रान्ते sporting ground for the elephant of Indra, चन्द्रसूर्यपथे in the path of Moon and Sun, शिवे an auspicious place, जीवलोकस्य for the living beings, ब्रह्मनिर्मिते created by Brahma, वितते extensive, विताने canopy, वरैः by the esteemed, वीरैः by heroes, विद्याधरगणैः by Vidyadhara groups, बहुशः frequently, सेविते attended by, वायुमार्गे the path of wind, मारुतिः Hanuman, गरुत्मानिव like Garuda, जगाम went.
translation: Hanuman passed through the path of wind like Garuda. The region was refreshed with clouds that released torrents of rain and frequented by birds. The great masters of music (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) trained in Kasika moved there driven by lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents and were moving in different aerial vehicles. It was splendid with god at fire who strikes fiercely like thunderbolt. It was inhabited by great sages who had acquired merit. The region was traversed by firegod who carried havis in large quantities earnestly. It was decorated with planets, constellations, Moon, Sun and clusters of stars. It was filled with groups of greal sages, gandharvas, nagas and yakshas. It was isolated part of the universe traversed by the king of gandharvas like Vishvavasu. It was an auspicious path for Moon and Sun, a sporting ground for Airavata, the vehicle of lord Indra. It was an extensive world of living beings created by Brahma. It was frequented by many heroes ascending to heaven and blocked by vidyadharas.

text:
सेविते वारिधाराभिः पतगैश्च निषेविते।

चरिते कैशिकाचार्यैरैरावतनिषेविते।।5.1.174।।

सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः।

विमानैः सम्पतद्भिश्च विमलैः समलङ्कृते।।5.1.175।।

वज्राशनिसमाघातैः पावकैरुपशोभिते।

कृतपुण्यैर्महाभागैः स्वर्गजिद्भिरलङ्कृते।।5.1.176।।

वहता हव्यमत्यर्धं सेविते चित्रभानुना।

ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागण विभूषिते।।5.1.177।।

महर्षिगणगन्धर्वनागयक्षसमाकुले।

विविक्ते विमले विश्वे विश्वावसुनिषेविते।।5.1.178।।

देवराजगजाक्रान्ते चन्द्रसूर्यपथे शिवे।

विताने जीवलोकस्य वितते ब्रह्मनिर्मिते।।5.1.179।।

बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः।

It was filled with groups of greal sages, gandharvas, nagas and yakshas. It was isolated part of the universe traversed by the king of gandharvas like Vishvavasu. It was an auspicious path for Moon and Sun, a sporting ground for Airavata, the vehicle of lord Indra. It was an extensive world of living beings created by Brahma. It was frequented by many heroes ascending to heaven and blocked by vidyadharas.

text:
प्रदृश्यमानः सर्वत्रः हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।

भेजेऽम्बरं निरालम्बं लम्बपक्ष इवाद्रिराट्।।5.1.181।।
meaning: सर्वत्र all over, प्रदृश्यमानः he appeared, मारुतात्मजः son of Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, लम्बपक्षः longwinged, अद्रिराट् इव like king of mountains, निरालम्बम् unsupported, अम्बरम् the sky, भेजे occupied.
translation:
Hanuman, son of the Windgod was seen everywhere in the sky. He appeared like a
longwinged king of mountains unsupported.

text:
प्लवमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा सिंहिका नाम राक्षसी।

मनसा चिन्तयामास प्रवृद्धा कामरूपिणी।।5.1.182।।
meaning: कामरूपिणी who can take any form at will, सिंहिका नाम called Simhika, राक्षसी demoness, प्लवमानम् him who was speeding in the sky, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रवृद्धा expanded in size, चिन्तयामास started thinking.
translation: Seeing Hanuman speeding in the sky a demoness called Simhika who can assume any form at her will had grown out of proportion and thought on her part:

text:
अद्य दीर्घस्य कालस्य भविष्याम्यहमाशिता।

इदं हि मे महत्सत्त्वं चिरस्य वशमागतम्।।5.1.183।।
meaning: चिरस्य after a long time, इदम् this, महत् great, सत्त्वम् being, मे my, वशम् fold, आगतम् has come, दीर्घस्य after a long, कालस्य time, अद्य today, अहम् I, आशिता satiated, भविष्यामि I will be.

text:
इति सञ्चिन्त्य मनसा छायामस्य समाक्षिपत्।

छायायां गृह्यमाणायां चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.1.184।।
meaning: इति thus, मनसा in her mind, सञ्चिन्त्य after thinking, अस्य his, छायाम् shadow, समाक्षिपत् pulled, छायायाम् when his shadow, गृह्यमाणायाम् was held, वानरः vanara, चिन्तयामास deliberated.
translation: Thinking thus, she dragged him by his shadow before she took hold of him, Hanuman started deliberating within.

text:
समाक्षिप्तोऽस्मि सहसा पङ्गूकृतपराक्रमः।

प्रतिलोमेन वातेन महानौरिव सागरे।।5.1.185।।
meaning: सागरे in the ocean, प्रतिलोमेन from the opposite side, वातेन by the wind, महानौरिव like a huge ship, पङ्गूकृतपराक्रमः powerless, सहसा suddenly, समाक्षिप्तः caught, अस्मि I am.
translation: "I am caught suddenly. I am handicapped.I am like a huge ship in an ocean retarded by the wind blowing from the opposite direction.

text:
तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधश्चैव वीक्षमाणस्ततः कपिः।

ददर्श स महत्सत्त्वमुत्थितं लवणाम्भसि।।5.1.186।।
meaning: ततः then, कपिः monkey, तिर्यक् horizontally, ऊर्द्वम् upward, अथश्चैव at the bottom level, वीक्षमाणः while looking at, लवणाम्भसि in the salt sea, उत्थितम् risen up, महत् huge, सत्त्वम् being, ददर्श saw.
translation: Looking around, right and left, up and down, the monkey saw a huge being rise from the salty sea.

text:
तद्धृष्ट्वा चिन्तयामास मारुतिर्विकृताननम्।

कपिराजेन कथितं सत्त्वमद्भुतदर्शनम्।।5.1.187।।

छायाग्राहि महावीर्यं तदिदं नात्र संशयः।
meaning: मारुतिः Maruti, विकृताननम् hideous countenance, तत् that creature, दृष्ट्वा seeing, चिन्तयामास reflected, कपिराजेन by the king of monkeys, कथितम् described, अद्भुतदर्शनम् of wonderful appearance, छायाग्राहि which can hold the shadow, महावीर्यम् very powerful, तत् that, सत्त्वम् creature, इदम् this, अत्र here it is, संशयः doubt, न no.
translation:
Seeing the form with a hideous countenance, Hanuman reflected about the creature of ugly appearance endowed with power which can catch a creature though his shadow, about which king Sugriva had once told him. 'It is the same creature, no doubt', said
Hanuman.

text:
स तां बुद्ध्वार्थतत्त्वेन सिंहिकां मतिमान्कपिः।।5.1.188।।

व्यवर्धत महाकायः प्रावृषीव वलाहकः।
meaning: मतिमान् wise one, सः कपिः Hanuman, ताम् her, अर्थतत्त्वेन by her true nature, सिंहिकाम् Simhika, बुद्ध्वा recognising, महाकायः huge bodied one, प्रावृषि in rainy season, वलाहकः इव like a cloud, व्यवर्धत grew.
translation: Recognising the true nature of Simhika the clutcher of shadows, the wise Hanuman grew to a huge size like a cloud in rainy season.

text:
तस्य सा कायमुद्वीक्ष्य वर्धमानं महाकपेः।।5.1.189।।

वक्त्रं प्रसारयामास पातालान्तरसन्निभम्।
meaning: सा she, तस्य महाकपेः Hanuman's, कायम् body, वर्धमानम् growing, उद्वीक्ष्य after observing, पातालान्तरसन्निभम् like the depth of the underworld, वक्त्रम् mouth, प्रसारयामास distended.
translation: Observing the body of Hanuman growing in size, Simhika started distending her mouth wide like the depth of the underworld.

text:
घनराजीव गर्जन्ती वानरं समभिद्रवत्।।5.1.190।।

स ददर्श ततस्तस्या विवृतं सुमहन्मुखम्।

कायमात्रं च मेधावी मर्माणि च महाकपिः।।5.1.191।।
meaning: घनराजीव like a mass of heavy clouds, गर्जन्ती roaring, वानरम् that vanara, समभिद्रवत् ran towards him, ततः then, मेधावी intelligent, महाकपिः Hanuman, तस्याः her, विवृतम् opened, कायमात्रम् body alone, सुमहत् enormous, मुखम् mouth, मर्माणि च vatal parts, सः he, ददर्श saw.
translation:
Roaring like a heavy mass of clouds, Simhika chased Hanuman. Intelligent Hanuman
observed her enormous mouth and noticed her vital parts.

text:
घनराजीव गर्जन्ती वानरं समभिद्रवत्।।5.1.190।।

स ददर्श ततस्तस्या विवृतं सुमहन्मुखम्।

कायमात्रं च मेधावी मर्माणि च महाकपिः।।5.1.191।।
meaning: घनराजीव like a mass of heavy clouds, गर्जन्ती roaring, वानरम् that vanara, समभिद्रवत् ran towards him, ततः then, मेधावी intelligent, महाकपिः Hanuman, तस्याः her, विवृतम् opened, कायमात्रम् body alone, सुमहत् enormous, मुखम् mouth, मर्माणि च vatal parts, सः he, ददर्श saw.
translation:
Roaring like a heavy mass of clouds, Simhika chased Hanuman. Intelligent Hanuman
observed her enormous mouth and noticed her vital parts.

text:
स तस्या विवृते वक्त्रे वज्रसंहननः कपिः।

संक्षिप्य मुहुरात्मानं निष्पपात महाबलः।।5.1.192।।
meaning: महाबलः strong one, वज्रसंहननः of thunderboltlike physique, सः कपिः that vanara, आत्मानम् himself, मुहुः once again, संक्षिप्य contracted, तस्याः her, विवृते open, वक्त्रे in the mouth, निष्पपात entered.
translation: Hanuman, the vanara whose physique was as hard as thunderbolt suddenly contracted once again and entered her opened mouth.

text:
आस्ये तस्या निमज्जन्तं ददृशुः सिद्धचारणाः।

ग्रस्यमानं यथा चन्द्रं पूर्णं पर्वणि राहुणा।।5.1.193।।
meaning: सिद्धचारणाः siddhas and charanas, तस्याः her, आस्ये in the mouth, निमज्जन्तम् drowning in, पर्वणि on fullmoon day, राहुणा by Rahu, ग्रस्यमानम् being seized, पूर्णम् full, चन्द्रं यथा like the Moon, ददृशुः saw.
translation: The siddhas and charanas who were watching his performance of drowning in her mouth were amazed as though the moon is seized by Rahu on a fullmoon night.

text:
ततस्तस्या नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्माण्युत्कृत्य वानरः।

उत्पपाताथ वेगेन मनः सम्पातविक्रमः।।5.1.194।।
meaning: ततः thay, वानरः vanara, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, नखैः with nails, तस्याः her, मर्माणि private vital parts, उत्कृत्य after tearing, अथ then, मनः सम्पातविक्रमः with the speed of mind in action, वेगेन quickly, उत्पपात rushed out.
translation: The vanara who had the speed of mind tore her vital parts with his sharp nails and rushed out quickly before she closed her mouth.

text:
तां तु दृष्ट्वा च धृत्या च दाक्षिण्येन निपात्य च।

स कपिप्रवरो वेगाद्ववृधे पुनरात्मवान्।।5.1.195।।
meaning: आत्मवान् selfcontrolled, सः he, कपिप्रवरः great monkey, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा च after seeing, धृत्या च with firmness of mind, दाक्षिण्येन with ingenuity, निपात्य thrown down, पुनः again, वेगात् rapidly, ववृधे grew in size.
translation: Selfcontrolled Hanuman, the great monkey acting with firmness of mind and ingenuity threw her down and once again rapidly grew in size.

text:
हृतहृत्सा हनुमतापपात विधुराम्भसि।

तां हतां वानरेणाशु पतितां वीक्ष्य सिंहिकाम्।।5.1.196।।

भूतान्याकाशचारीणि तमूचुः प्लवगोत्तमम्।
meaning: सा that, हनुमता by Hanuman, हृतहृत् heart torn, विधुरा miserable, अम्भसि into water, पपात fell down, वानरेण by vanara, आशु instantly, हताम् killed, पतिताम् dropped, वीक्ष्य seeing, आकाशाचारीणि moving in the sky, भूतानि beings, तम् him, प्लवगोत्तमम् best of vanaras, ऊचुः addressed.
translation: Heart torn asunder and killed by Hanuman, miserable Simhika instantly fell into the sea water. Observing it, the beings who ranged the sky said to the foremost of vanaras:

text:
भीममद्य कृतं कर्म महत्सत्त्वं त्वया हतम्।।5.1.197।।

साधयार्थमभिप्रेतमरिष्टं प्लवतां वर।
meaning: प्लवतां वर O great jumper, अद्य to day, त्वया by you, महत् great, सत्त्वम् creature, हतम् is destroyed, भीमम् fierce, कर्म action, कृतम् done, अभिप्रेतम् intention, अर्थम् aim, अरिष्टम् unobstructed, साधय you fulfill
translation:
"O great jumper a great deed has been done by you today in killing that fierce
creature. O great monkey fulfil your mission without any obstruction.

text:
यस्य त्वेतानि चत्वारि वानरेन्द्र यथा तव।।5.1.198।।

धृतिर्दृष्टिर्मतिर्दाक्ष्यं सः कर्मसु न सीदति।
meaning: वानरेन्द्र O lord of vanara, यस्य in whom, धृतिः fortitude, दृष्टिः vision, मतिः intelligence, दाक्ष्यम् dexterity, एतानि these, चत्वारि four, तव यथा as in you, स: he, कर्मसु in missions, न सीदति will not get lost.
translation: "O lord of vanaras he in whom these four qualities, fortitude, vision, intelligence and dexterity exist as in you will achieve his mission and not get lost".

text:
स तैः सम्भावितः पूज्यः प्रतिपन्नप्रयोजनः।।5.1.199।।

जगामाकाशमाविश्य पन्नगाशनवत्कपिः।
meaning: पूज्यः a venerable one, सः कपिः that monkey, तैः by them, सम्भावितः honoured, प्रतिपन्नप्रयोजनः achieved the objective, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य having ascended, पन्नगाशानवत् like Garuda, जगाम went.
translation: Honoured by them the venerable monkey went ascending into the sky like Garuda to achieve the objective.

text:
प्राप्तभूयिष्ठपारस्तु सर्वतः प्रतिलोकयन्।।5.1.200।।

योजनानां शतस्यान्ते वनराजिं ददर्श सः।
meaning: प्राप्तभूयिष्ठपारः on reaching the other side of the shore, सर्वतः all over, प्रतिलोकयन् looked around, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतस्य of a hundred, अन्ते at the end of, वनराजिम् rows of forest trees, ददर्श saw.
translation: On reaching the other side of the shore crossing a hundred yojanas, he saw rows of forest trees.

text:
ददर्श च पतन्नेव विविधद्रुमभूषितम्।।5.1.201।।

द्वीपं शाखामृगश्रेष्ठो मलयोपवनानि च।
meaning: शाखामृगश्रेष्ठः best among the animals that jump on branches, monkeys, पतन्नेन onwhile yet on air, विविधद्रुमभूषितम् adorned with several kinds of beautiful trees, द्वीपम् island, मलयोपवनानि gardens bordering Malaya mountain, ददर्श च also saw.
translation: Hanuman, the best among jumpers, even while in air he saw an island adorned with many trees, also gardens adjacent to Malaya mountain.
